sub_topic: Identifying the type of bonding in a solid (ionic, covalent, metallic)
message_1: What is the type of bonding present in Sodium Chloride (NaCl)?
message_2: The type of bonding present in Sodium Chloride (NaCl) is ionic bonding. This occurs when a metal (Sodium, Na) transfers one or more electrons to a non-metal (Chlorine, Cl) to form positively charged cations (Na+) and negatively charged anions (Cl-). These ions are then attracted to each other due to the electrostatic forces between them, forming an ionic compound.
